item.title: Gauthier CHICOT
item.description: Gauthier Chicot, Ing., PhD, is the CEO and co-founder of DiamFab. After completing his engineering studies in Electronics at Polytech’ Grenoble, he earned his PhD in Nanoelectronics and Nanotechnology from the University of Grenoble in 2013. At the CEA and CNRS, his research primarily focused on ultra-wide band gap semiconductors, specifically the development of power electronics components using diamond. He particularly concentrated on optimizing the performance of these components in direct relation to epitaxial diamond layers during a post-doctoral research position at G2ELab. Leveraging this expertise, he began working in 2017 to commercialize the research outcomes from CNRS/Institut Néel, which led to the founding of the startup DIAMFAB in 2019, which he has led since its inception.

item.title: Jean Christophe Crébier
item.description: Jean-Christophe Crébier is a CNRS researcher at the Grenoble Electrical Engineering Laboratory (G2Elab). With over 20 years of research experience in various fields of power electronics (semiconductors, 3D packaging, integrated drivers, multicellular converters, etc.), his current work focuses on identifying the conditions for the sustainability of power electronics technology. He is also the CSR representative for his laboratory, and at the national level, he co-leads working groups on more sustainable electronics. More recently, he has become involved in coordinating the Reflection Group of the GDR labo1point5.
